title: The ‘Maleficent’ Screenwriter on Making an ‘Evil’ Character a Fan Favorite
text:
Back in 1979, when Linda Woolverton was running a children’s theater company, she had a career-changing revelation. Performing one day in a penguin costume for a handful of restive children, she thought: “There’s got to be a way to reach more kids than this.”

Since then, few people have reached more children than Ms. Woolverton, who disbanded her company and pursued a career that led to screenwriting. As the screenwriter of “Beauty and the Beast” (1991) and co-writer of “The Lion King” (1994), she was at the center of the...
description: A children’s theater company paved the way for Linda Woolverton, writer of “Maleficent: Mistress of Evil,” to a career that includes “The Lion King” and “Beauty and the Beast.”
